content: रागः [रंज्-भावे घञ् नि° नलोपकुत्वे] {@--1@} ({%a%}) Colouring, dyeing, tinging. ({%b%}) Colour, hue, dye; <ls>Pt. 1. 33.</ls> {@--2@} Red colour, redness; अधरः किसलयरागः <ls>Ś. 1. 21.</ls> {@--3@} Red dye, red lac; रागेण बालारुणकोमलेन चूतप्रवालोष्ठमलंचकार <ls>Ku. 3. 30</ls>, <ls n="Ku.">5. 11.</ls> {@--4@} Love, passion, affection, amorous or sexual feeling; मलिनेपि रागपूर्णां <ls>Bv. 1. 100</ls> (where it means ‘redness’ also); अथ भवंतमंतरेण कीदृशोऽस्या दृष्टिरागः <ls>Ś. 2</ls>; see चक्षूराग also; चरणयुगलादिव हृदयमविशद्रागः <ls>K. 142.</ls> {@--5@} Feeling, emotion, sympathy, interest. {@--6@} Joy, pleasure. {@--7@} Anger, wrath. {@--8@} Loveliness, beauty. {@--9@} A musical mode or order of sound; (there are six primary {%Rāgas%}; भैरवः कौशिकश्चैव हिंदोलो दीपकस्तथा . श्रीरागो मेघरागश्च रागाः षडिति कीर्तिताः <ls>Bharata</ls>; other writers give different names. Each {%rāga%} has six {%rāginīs%} regarded as its consorts, and their union gives rise to several musical modes). {@--10@} Musical harmony, melody; तवास्मि गीतरागेण हारिणा प्रसभं हृतः <ls>Ś. 1. 5</ls>; अहो रागपरिवाहिणी गीतिः <ls>Ś. 5.</ls> {@--11@} Regret, sorrow. {@--12@} Greediness, envy. {@--13@} The quality called Rajas <ab>q. v.</ab> {@--14@} Nasalization. {@--15@} A process in the preparation of quicksilver. {@--16@} A king, prince. {@--17@} The sun. {@--18@} The moon.
